intro: Haemanthus pubescens subsp. arenicola, commonly known as the coastal haemanthus, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It is characterized by its rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves that are densely covered in fine hairs. The plant produces striking red-orange flowers in late summer, which are borne on short, upright stems. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to coastal environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
